questions.explanation:
Explanation: The IEEE 802.3 Data Link Layer is divided into two distinct sublayers: the Logical Link Control (LLC) and the Media Access Control (MAC). The LLC sublayer (defined by the IEEE 802.2 standard) acts as the software interface between the upper layers and the hardware. Its primary functions include:
  • Protocol Identification: The LLC sublayer adds information to the frame to identify which Network Layer protocol (e.g., IPv4, IPv6, or IPX) is being carried. This allows multiple Layer 3 protocols to share the same network interface and media.
  • Encapsulation Control: It adds control information to the network protocol data (the PDU from Layer 3) to help deliver the packet to its destination process.
  • Link Management: It provides synchronization, flow control, and error-checking functions (though most error recovery is now handled at higher layers).
Incorrect Options:
  • Applies source and destination MAC addresses: This is a function of the MAC sublayer. The MAC sublayer is responsible for data encapsulation (framing) and hardware addressing.
  • Implements CSMA/CD over legacy shared media: Media access methods like CSMA/CD or CSMA/CA are handled by the MAC sublayer, as they dictate how the hardware accesses the physical medium.
  • Integrates Layer 2 flows between different media speeds: The transition between different physical media (fiber vs. copper) or speeds (10G vs. 1G) is managed by the MAC sublayer and the Physical Layer (PHY).
options: adds Ethernet control information to network protocol data
places information in the Ethernet frame that identifies which network layer protocol is being encapsulated by the frame
applies source and destination MAC addresses to Ethernet frame
implements CSMA/CD over legacy shared half-duplex media
integrates Layer 2 flows between 10 Gigabit Ethernet over fiber and 1 Gigabit Ethernet over copper
questions.question: Which two functions are performed at the LLC sublayer of the OSI Data Link Layer to facilitate Ethernet communication?

questions.explanation: N/A
questions.question: Which two issues can cause both runts and giants in Ethernet networks? (Choose two.)

questions.explanation: The history command allows you to view and reuse previously entered commands stored in the buffer. It is also used to manage the size of the buffer.
options: View a list of commands entered in a previous session.
Recall up to 15 command lines by default.
Set the command history buffer size.
Save command lines in a log file for future reference.
questions.question: Which tasks can be accomplished by using the command history feature? (Choose two.)
What type of Ethernet cable would be used to connect one switch to another switch when neither switch supports the auto-MDIX feature?
questions.explanation: A crossover cable can be used to connect a switch to a switch, a computer to a computer, and a router to a router. A straight-through cable can be used to connect a computer or a router to a switch. A rollover cable can be used to access a router or switch console line. A coaxial cable is not used any longer in Ethernet networks, but can be found in video connections.

questions.question: Which statement is true about broadcast and collision domains?
options: Adding a router to a network will increase the size of the collision domain.
The size of the collision domain can be reduced by adding hubs to a network.
The more interfaces a router has the larger the resulting broadcast domain.
Adding a switch to a network will increase the size of the broadcast domain.
questions.explanation: A switch that receives a broadcast frame will forward the frame out all other interfaces, including interfaces that connect to other switches. These switches will also perform the same forwarding action. By adding more switches to the network, the size of the broadcast domain increases. Routers separate both broadcast and collision domains. Hubs do not reduce collision domains - they extend them.

questions.question: What is the significant difference between a hub and a Layer 2 LAN switch?
options: A hub divides collision domains, and a switch divides broadcast domains.
A switch creates many smaller collision domains, and a hub increases the size of a single collision domain.
Each port of a hub is a collision domain, and each port of a switch is a broadcast domain.
A hub forwards frames, and a switch forwards only packets.
questions.explanation: Hubs operate only at the physical layer, forwarding bits as wire signals out all ports, and extend the collision domain of a network. Switches forward frames at the data link layer and each switch port is a separate collision domain, creating more but smaller collision domains. Switches do not manage broadcast domains because broadcast frames are always forwarded out all active ports.

questions.question: Which two statements are true about half-duplex and full-duplex communications? (Choose two.)
options: Full duplex offers 100 percent potential use of the bandwidth.
Half duplex has only one channel.
All modern NICs support both half-duplex and full-duplex communication.
Full duplex allows both ends to transmit and receive simultaneously.
Full duplex increases the effective bandwidth.
questions.explanation: Full-duplex communication allows both ends to transmit and receive simultaneously, offering 100 percent efficiency in both directions for a 200 percent potential use of stated bandwidth. This effectively doubles the bandwidth compared to half-duplex. Half-duplex communication is unidirectional, or one direction at a time. Gigabit Ethernet and 10 Gb/s NICs require full duplex to operate, and do not support half-duplex operation.

questions.question: Which network device can serve as a boundary to divide a Layer 2 broadcast domain?
questions.explanation: Layer 1 and 2 devices (LAN switch and Ethernet hub) and access point devices do not filter MAC broadcast frames. Only a Layer 3 device, such as a router, can divide a Layer 2 broadcast domain. Each router interface connects to a separate broadcast domain.

questions.question: Which network device can be used to eliminate collisions on an Ethernet network?
questions.explanation: A switch provides microsegmentation so that no other device competes for the same Ethernet network bandwidth. Each switch port creates a separate collision domain, effectively eliminating collisions. Hubs extend collision domains, while routers and firewalls operate at higher layers.

questions.question: Which solution would help a college alleviate network congestion due to collisions?
options: a firewall that connects to two Internet providers
a router with two Ethernet ports
a router with three Ethernet ports
questions.explanation: Switches provide microsegmentation so that one device does not compete for the same Ethernet network bandwidth with another network device, thus practically eliminating collisions. A high port density switch provides very fast connectivity for many devices, with each port being its own collision domain.

questions.question: Which command is used to set the BOOT environment variable that defines where to find the IOS image file on a switch?
questions.explanation: The boot system command is used to set the BOOT environment variable that specifies the location of the IOS image. The config-register and confreg commands are used to set the configuration register. The boot loader command supports commands to format the flash file system, reinstall the operating system software, and recover from a lost or forgotten password.

questions.question: Which impact does adding a Layer 2 switch have on a network?
options: an increase in the number of dropped frames
an increase in the size of the broadcast domain
an increase in the number of network collisions
an increase in the size of the collision domain
questions.explanation: Adding a Layer 2 switch to a network increases the number of collision domains (each port is its own collision domain) and increases the size of the broadcast domain (all ports share the same broadcast domain). Layer 2 switches do not decrease the amount of broadcast traffic, do not increase the amount of network collisions, and do not increase the number of dropped frames.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit showing a network with 4 routers connected in a mesh topology, each with a LAN (15 hosts, 20 hosts, 8 hosts, and 12 hosts). How many broadcast domains are displayed?
questions.explanation: A router defines a broadcast boundary, so every link between two routers is a broadcast domain. In the exhibit, 4 links between routers make 4 broadcast domains. Also, each LAN that is connected to a router is a broadcast domain. The 4 LANs in the exhibit result in 4 more broadcast domains, so there are 8 broadcast domains in all.

questions.question: A client creates a packet to send to a server. The client is requesting SSH service. What number will be used as the destination port number in the sending packet?
questions.explanation: SSH (Secure Shell) uses well-known port 22 for secure remote access. Port 69 is TFTP, port 67 is DHCP server, and port 80 is HTTP. When a client initiates an SSH connection, the destination port in the packet will be 22.

questions.question: In the context of mobile devices, what does the term tethering involve?
options: Connecting a mobile device to a 4G cellular network
Connecting a mobile device to a USB port on a computer in order to charge the mobile device
Connecting a mobile device to a hands-free headset
Connecting a mobile device to another mobile device or computer to share a network connection
questions.explanation: Tethering allows a laptop or PC to use the Internet connection of a mobile device such as a cell phone, usually through a cellular data connection. This allows devices to connect to the Internet in locations where there is no Wi-Fi or cabled connection, but where there is still a cellular data connection.

questions.question: Which type of telecommunication technology is used to provide Internet access to vessels at sea?
questions.explanation: Internet access by means of satellites is available across the world. Temporary installations, airplanes in flight, and naval vessels benefit from the use of satellite internet. Municipal Wi-Fi, WiMax, and cellular technology are not able to support the mobile requirements of naval vessels and airplanes in transit.

questions.question: Match the definitions to their respective CLI hot keys and shortcuts.

leftColumn.label: scrolls backwards through previously entered commands
aborts commands such as trace and ping

questions.explanation: The Tab key completes a partially entered command or keyword. Space bar displays the next screen when output is longer than the terminal display. Up Arrow recalls previous commands from the history buffer. The question mark (?) provides context-sensitive help for commands. Ctrl-Shift-6 (or Ctrl+C on some systems) interrupts commands like ping and traceroute.

questions.question: A network administrator requires access to manage routers and switches locally and remotely. Match the description to the access method.

leftColumn.label: remote access method that uses encryption
remote access via a dialup connection

questions.explanation: SSH provides encrypted remote access and is the secure alternative to Telnet. The console port provides out-of-band access, meaning it doesn't require network connectivity. The AUX port allows remote access via a modem and dialup connection. Telnet transmits data in plaintext and is considered unsecure.

questions.question: Match the commands to the correct actions.

leftColumn.label: configures a name on the router
displays a message after accessing the router

questions.explanation: The hostname command sets the device name. The password command under line configuration mode sets a password for console access. The banner motd command creates a message of the day banner that displays when users access the device.

questions.question: Match the configuration mode with the command that is available in that mode.
questions.explanation: User EXEC mode (R1>) allows the enable command to enter privileged EXEC mode. Privileged EXEC mode (R1#) allows the copy running-config startup-config command. Line configuration mode (R1(config-line)#) allows the login command. Global configuration mode (R1(config)#) allows the interface command to enter interface configuration mode.

questions.question: Match the command with the device mode at which the command is entered.
questions.explanation: service password-encryption is a global configuration command. enable is entered from user EXEC mode. copy running-config startup-config is a privileged EXEC command. login is a line configuration command. ip address is an interface configuration command.

questions.question: A client application needs to terminate a TCP communication session with a server. Place the termination process steps in the order that they will occur.
questions.explanation: TCP connection termination uses a four-way handshake: 1) Client sends FIN to initiate termination, 2) Server acknowledges with ACK, 3) Server sends its own FIN, 4) Client sends final ACK. This is also known as the FIN-ACK, FIN-ACK sequence.

questions.question: Match the descriptions to the terms.

leftColumn.label: users interact with the operating system by typing commands
enables the user to interact with the operating system by pointing and clicking
the part of the OS that interacts directly with the device hardware
the part of the operating system that interfaces with applications and the user

questions.explanation: CLI (Command Line Interface) allows text-based interaction. GUI (Graphical User Interface) uses visual elements for interaction. The kernel is the core OS component managing hardware. The shell is the interface layer between the user/applications and the kernel.

questions.question: Match the description with the media.

rightColumn.label: This type of copper media is used in industrial or similar environments where there is a lot of interference
Traditionally used for television but can now be used in a network to connect the customer location to the wiring of the customer premises
This type of media is used for high transmission speed and can also transfer data over long distances
This type of media provides the most mobility options

questions.explanation: STP (Shielded Twisted Pair) is used in environments with high EMI. Coaxial cable is used for cable TV and internet connections. Optical fiber provides high-speed, long-distance transmission. Wireless provides the greatest mobility.

questions.question: Categorize the following devices as either end devices or intermediary devices.
questions.explanation: End devices are the source or destination of data and include PCs, printers, smart devices, servers, and IP phones. Intermediary devices connect end devices to the network and include routers, switches, firewalls, wireless access points, and hubs.

questions.question: What type of Ethernet cable would be used to connect one switch to another switch when neither switch supports the auto-MDIX feature?
questions.explanation: A straight-through cable can be used to connect a computer or a router to a switch. A rollover cable can be used to access a router or switch console line. A coaxial cable is not used any longer in Ethernet networks, but can be found in video connections. A crossover cable can be used to connect a switch to a switch, a computer to a computer, and a router to a router.

questions.question: Which statement is true about broadcast and collision domains?
options: Adding a router to a network will increase the size of the collision domain.
The size of the collision domain can be reduced by adding hubs to a network.
The more interfaces a router has the larger the resulting broadcast domain.
Adding a switch to a network will increase the size of the broadcast domain.
questions.explanation: A switch that receives a broadcast frame will forward the frame out all other interfaces, including interfaces that connect to other switches. These switches will also perform the same forwarding action. By adding more switches to the network, the size of the broadcast domain increases.

questions.question: Which command is used to set the BOOT environment variable that defines where to find the IOS image file on a switch?
questions.explanation: The boot system command is used to set the BOOT environment variable. The config-register and confreg commands are used to set the configuration register. The boot loader command supports commands to format the flash file system, reinstall the operating system software, and recover from a lost or forgotten password.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. How many broadcast domains are displayed? (4 routers interconnected in a central hub topology, each router with a LAN - 15 hosts, 20 hosts, 8 hosts, and 12 hosts)
questions.explanation: A router defines a broadcast boundary, so every link between two routers is a broadcast domain. In the exhibit, 4 links between routers make 4 broadcast domains. Also, each LAN that is connected to a router is a broadcast domain. The 4 LANs in the exhibit result in 4 more broadcast domains, so there are 8 broadcast domains in all.

The Tour classes of threats are as follows: - Hardware threats - physical damage to servers, routers, switches, cabling plant, and workstations - Environmental threats - temperature extremes (too hot or too cold) or humidity extremes (too wet or too dry) - Electrical threats - voltage spikes, insufficient supply voltage (brownouts), unconditioned power (noise), and total power loss - Maintenance threats - poor handling of key electrical components (electrostatic discharge), lack of critical spare parts, poor cabling, and poor labeling.
questions.question: Some routers and switches in a wiring closet malfunctioned after an air conditioning unit failed. What type of threat does this situation describe?

questions.explanation: The explanation is already clear and correctly identifies the purpose of a network reconnaissance attack.
options: Denying access to resources by legitimate users
questions.question: What is the objective of a network reconnaissance attack?

questions.explanation: SNMPv3 is the only version that provides authentication, encryption, and message integrity. SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c use community strings (essentially passwords) that are sent in clear text, making them insecure. SNMPv3 adds user-based security with authentication using MD5 or SHA, and encryption using DES or AES. SNMPv3 is the recommended version for production networks.
questions.question: Which SNMP version provides encryption and authentication?

questions.explanation: A vulnerability is a weakness or flaw in a system (such as outdated software, misconfiguration, or weak passwords) that could be exploited. A threat is a potential danger or attack that could exploit a vulnerability to cause harm. An exploit is the actual method or tool used to take advantage of a vulnerability. Risk is the likelihood that a threat will exploit a vulnerability, combined with the impact it would have.
options: A threat is a weakness, a vulnerability is an attack
A vulnerability is a weakness, a threat is a potential danger that could exploit it
A threat is internal, a vulnerability is external
questions.question: What is the difference between a threat and a vulnerability?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 7

questions.explanation: The 'enable secret Cisco123' command sets an encrypted password using MD5 hashing. The 'enable password' command stores the password in plaintext or with weak Type 7 encryption if 'service password-encryption' is enabled. The 'enable secret' command always uses stronger MD5 hashing and should always be used instead of 'enable password'. If both are configured, the secret takes precedence.
questions.question: Which command sets the enable password to 'Cisco123' with encryption?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 1, Chapter 7

questions.explanation: Multifactor authentication (MFA) requires users to provide multiple forms of verification (something you know, have, or are), significantly enhancing security. Password complexity requirements enforce strong passwords with minimum length, character diversity, etc. Telnet doesn't provide encryption (SSH does), MAC address filtering is easily spoofed, and CDP is a discovery protocol not related to password security.
questions.question: Which two security features enhance password security on Cisco devices? (Choose two)
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 7

questions.explanation: Access Control Lists (ACLs) filter network traffic based on criteria such as source IP address, destination IP address, protocol, and port numbers. ACLs can be applied inbound or outbound on router interfaces to permit or deny traffic. They are used for security (blocking unwanted traffic) and traffic control (QoS, policy routing). ACLs are processed top-down with an implicit deny at the end.
options: To filter traffic based on criteria such as source/destination IP addresses
To assign IP addresses to hosts
questions.question: What is the purpose of an Access Control List (ACL) on a router?

questions.explanation: In a centralized (controller-based) wireless architecture, the Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) handles client authentication, encryption, and policy enforcement. Lightweight Access Points (LAPs) forward all management and control traffic to the WLC via CAPWAP tunnels. This centralized approach simplifies management and provides consistent policy enforcement across all APs. The LAPs primarily handle radio transmission and reception.
questions.question: In a centralized wireless architecture, which device is responsible for handling client authentication and encryption?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 18

questions.explanation: In a Layer 2 switch, the switch virtual interface (SVI) is used for remote management. It provides an IP address for the switch, enabling remote access through protocols like SSH or Telnet.
questions.question: Which interface allows remote management of a Layer 2 switch?

questions.explanation: DHCP snooping is a Layer 2 security feature that prevents rogue DHCP servers from distributing incorrect network information. It designates ports as trusted (connected to legitimate DHCP servers) or untrusted (connected to users). DHCP server messages are only allowed on trusted ports. It also builds a binding table of MAC addresses, IP addresses, VLAN IDs, and ports, which is used by other security features like Dynamic ARP Inspection (DAI) and IP Source Guard.
options: Prevents rogue DHCP servers and validates DHCP messages
questions.question: What does DHCP snooping do to enhance network security?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 5

questions.explanation: SSH verschlÃ¼sselt Daten und bietet Benutzerauthentifizierung, wÃ¤hrend Telnet Daten im Klartext sendet und keine VerschlÃ¼sselung bietet, was es unsicher macht.
options: SSH makes connections over the network, whereas Telnet is for out-of-band access.
SSH provides security to remote sessions by encrypting messages and using user authentication. Telnet is considered insecure and sends messages in plaintext.
SSH requires the use of the PuTTY terminal emulation program. Tera Term must be used to connect to devices through the use of Telnet.
SSH must be configured over an active network connection, whereas Telnet is used to connect to a device from a console connection.

SSH is the preferred protocol for connecting to a device operating system over the network because it is much more secure than Telnet. Both SSH and Telnet are used to connect to devices over the network, and so are both used in-band. PuTTY and Terra Term can be used to make both SSH and Telnet connections.
questions.question: How is SSH different from Telnet?

questions.explanation: In port security 'restrict' violation mode, frames from unauthorized MAC addresses are dropped, an SNMP trap is sent, a syslog message is logged, and the violation counter increments, but the port remains operational for authorized MAC addresses. In 'shutdown' mode (default), the port is error-disabled. In 'protect' mode, frames are dropped but no notification is sent. Port security limits the number of MAC addresses allowed on a port.
options: The port shuts down and must be manually re-enabled
Traffic from the violating MAC is dropped and a syslog message is sent
Traffic from the violating MAC is dropped with no notification
All traffic is allowed but logged
questions.question: What happens when port security detects a violation in 'restrict' mode?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 4

questions.explanation: WPA3 (Wi-Fi Protected Access 3) provides the strongest encryption and security for wireless networks. It uses Simultaneous Authentication of Equals (SAE) instead of the Pre-Shared Key (PSK) method, providing better protection against offline dictionary attacks. WPA3 also offers Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) and 192-bit encryption in WPA3-Enterprise mode. WEP is obsolete and easily cracked, WPA has known vulnerabilities, and WPA2, while still secure, is being superseded by WPA3.
questions.question: Which security setting provides the strongest encryption for a wireless network?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 19

questions.explanation: AAA stands for Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting. Authentication verifies the identity of a user (who you are), Authorization determines what resources the user can access (what you can do), and Accounting tracks what the user does and the resources consumed (what you did). AAA can be implemented using protocols like RADIUS or TACACS+. TACACS+ is Cisco proprietary and separates AAA functions, while RADIUS is an open standard.
questions.question: What does AAA stand for in network security?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 7

questions.explanation: WPA2 uses AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) for encryption, specifically AES-CCMP (Counter Mode with Cipher Block Chaining Message Authentication Code Protocol). This is much more secure than WEP's RC4 encryption or WPA's TKIP. WPA3 also uses AES but with additional security enhancements like SAE (Simultaneous Authentication of Equals) instead of PSK (Pre-Shared Key). AES is a symmetric encryption algorithm approved by the U.S. government for classified information.
questions.question: Which encryption method does WPA2 use?
references: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide Vol 2, Chapter 19

questions.explanation: Spyware is a type of malicious software that is installed on a device without the user's knowledge and collects information about the user's activities, such as browsing habits, which can then be transmitted to a third party.
questions.question: During a routine inspection, a technician discovered that software that was installed on a computer was secretly collecting data about websites that were visited by users of the computer. Which type of threat is affecting this computer?

questions.explanation: The VTY lines are the Virtual Terminal lines of the router, used solely to control inbound Telnet connections while console 0 is the physical console port an the switch/router you plug into. The line vty command is used to remote configure access into the switch/router via telnet or ssh.
options:
Router(config)# line vty 0 4
Router(config-line)# password manage
Router(config-line)# exit
Router(config)# enable password cisco

Router(config)# line vty 0 4
Router(config-line)# password cisco
Router(config-line)# login

Router(config)# line console 0
Router(config-line)# password cisco
Router(config-line)#login

Router(config)# line console 0
Router(config-line)# password cisco
Router(config-line)# exit
Router(config)# service password-encryption
questions.question: An administrator is configuring a new router to permit out-of-band management access. Which set of commands will allow the required login using a password of cisco?

questions.explanation: Virtual private networks (VPN) are used to provide secure access to remote workers by encrypting data and ensuring privacy over the internet.
questions.question: An employee wants to access the network of the organization remotely, in the safest possible way. What network feature would allow an employee to gain secure remote access to a company network?

questions.explanation:
The enable secret command is used to provide security for entering Privileged EXEC mode (the mode where the prompt ends in a #). This is the most critical password on a Cisco device because it grants the user full administrative access to view and change configurations.Why the other options are incorrect:
  • Virtual terminal (VTY): These lines (Telnet/SSH) are secured using the password command under the line vty configuration mode.
  • Console line: This physical access port is secured using the password command under the line console 0 configuration mode.
  • AUX port: Similar to the console line, this is secured using the password command under the line aux 0 configuration mode.
questions.question: Which type of access is secured on a Cisco router or switch with the enable secret command?

questions.explanation: Topic 2.2.0 - If a Cisco IOS device has a valid IOS and a valid configuration file, it will boot into user EXEC mode. A password will be required to enter privileged EXEC mode.
questions.question: A router with a valid operating system contains a configuration file stored in NVRAM. The configuration file has an enable secret password but no console password. When the router boots up, which mode will display?

questions.explanation:
The service password-encryption global configuration command applies a weak (Type 7) encryption to all current and future passwords stored in the configuration file (such as console, VTY, and enable password). Its primary purpose is to prevent "shoulder surfing" or unauthorized viewing of the running-config or startup-config in plain text.Why the other options are incorrect:
  • (config)# enable secret... : While this command creates a highly secure, hashed password for Privileged EXEC mode, it only affects that specific password. It does not encrypt other plain-text passwords (like those for the console or VTY lines).
  • (config-line)# password secret: This is used to set a plain-text password for a specific line (like the console); it does not provide global encryption for the configuration file.
  • (config)# enable password secret: This sets the legacy, unencrypted enable password to the word "secret." It is considered insecure and is overridden by the enable secret command.
questions.question: What command will prevent all unencrypted passwords from displaying in plain text in a configuration file?

questions.explanation: The service password-encryption command encrypts all plaintext passwords in both the startup-config and running-config files to prevent unauthorized viewing. It uses a simple encryption method to obscure passwords, providing a basic level of security.
options: This command encrypts passwords as they are transmitted across serial WAN links.
This command prevents someone from viewing the running configuration passwords.
This command enables a strong encryption algorithm for the enable secret password command.
This command automatically encrypts passwords in configuration files that are currently stored in NVRAM.
This command provides an exclusive encrypted password for external service personnel who are required to do router maintenance.
The startup-config and running-config files display most passwords in plaintext. Use the service password-encryption global config command to encrypt all plaintext passwords in these files.
questions.question: A network administrator enters the service password-encryption command into the configuration mode of a router. What does this command accomplish?

questions.explanation: IPv4 has a 32-bit address space, providing 4,294,967,296 unique addresses, but only 3.7 billion are assignable, a limit due to address reservation for multicasting and testing. IPv4 does not provide native support for IPsec. IPv6 has a simplified header with fewer fields than IPv4 has.
options: All IPv4 addresses are assignable to hosts.
An IPv4 header has fewer fields than an IPv6 header has.
questions.question: Which statement accurately describes a characteristic of IPv4?

questions.explanation: The explanation is already clear and correctly identifies the purpose of the 'service password-encryption' command.
questions.question: Which command is used to encrypt all passwords in a router configuration file?

questions.explanation: The command 'enable secret' is preferred over 'enable password' because it encrypts the password using a stronger hashing algorithm (MD5), providing better security. 'service password-encryption' only encrypts passwords in the configuration file, not the enable password.
questions.question: Company policy requires using the most secure method to safeguard access to the privileged exec and configuration mode on the routers. The privileged exec password is trustknow1. Which of the following router commands achieves the goal of providing the highest level of security?

questions.explanation: The service password-encryption command is used to encrypt all passwords in the running configuration that are displayed in plain text. This enhances security by preventing unauthorized users from viewing passwords.
options: It is configured in privileged EXEC mode.
It encrypts only line mode passwords.
As soon as the service password-encryption command is entered, all currently set passwords formerly displayed in plain text are encrypted.
To see the passwords encrypted by the service password-encryption command in plain text, issue the no service password-encryption command.
questions.question: Which statement regarding the service password-encryption command is true?

questions.explanation: In an ARP spoofing attack, a malicious host intercepts ARP requests and replies to them so that network hosts will map an IP address to the MAC address of the malicious host.
options: to flood the network with ARP reply broadcasts
to fill switch MAC address tables with bogus addresses
to associate IP addresses to the wrong MAC address
to overwhelm network hosts with ARP requests
questions.question: What is the aim of an ARP spoofing attack?

questions.explanation: The three commands needed to password protect the console port are as follows: line console 0 password cisco login The interface fastethernet 0/0 command is commonly used to access the configuration mode used to apply specific parameters such as the IP address to the Fa0/0 port. The line vty 0 4 command is used to access the configuration mode for Telnet. The 0 and 4 parameters specify ports 0 through 4, or a maximum of live simultaneous Telnet connections. The enable secret command is used to apply a password used an the router to access the privileged mode.
questions.question: Which three commands are used to set up secure access to a router through a connection to the console interface? (Choose three.)

questions.explanation: The IP address 192.168.25.10 is an IPv4 private address. This address will not be routed over the Internet, so school A will not be able to reach school B. Because the address is a private one, it can be used freely on an internal network. As long as no two devices on the internal network are assigned the same private IP, there is no IP conflict issue. Devices that are assigned a private IP will need to use NAT in order to communicate over the Internet.
options: This is a private IP address.
There is an IP address conflict.
questions.question: A high school in New York (school A) is using videoconferencing technology to establish student interactions with another high school (school B) in Russia. The videoconferencing is conducted between two end devices through the Internet. The network administrator of school A configures the end device with the IP address 209.165.201.10. The administrator sends a request for the IP address for the end device in school B and the response is 192.168.25.10. Neither school is using a VPN. The administrator knows immediately that this IP will not work. Why?

categories.label: Not required steps for SSH configuration

items: Use the transport input ssh command

questions.explanation: SSH requires specific configuration steps on a Cisco switch. The required steps are: 1) Create a local user for authentication, 2) Generate RSA keys for encryption, 3) Configure a domain name (required for RSA key generation), 4) Use 'login local' to enable local authentication, and 5) Use 'transport input ssh' to allow only SSH connections. The 'use login local' step is NOT required as this is automatically enabled with 'login local' command.
questions.question: Identify the steps needed to configure a switch for SSH. The answer order does not matter.

questions.explanation: Topic 16.3.0 - Antivirus and antimalware software are used to prevent infection from malicious software. A port scanner is used to test a PC network connection to determine which ports the PC is listening to. The security center is an area of Windows that keeps track of the security software and settings on the PC. A firewall is designed to block unsolicited connection attempts to a PC unless they are specifically permitted.
questions.question: Which component is designed to protect against unauthorized communications to and from a computer?

questions.explanation: Topic 16.4.0 - The correct syntax is RouterA(config)# login block-for (number of seconds) attempts (number of attempts) within (number of seconds).
questions.question: Which command will block login attempts on RouterA for a period of 30 seconds if there are 2 failed login attempts within 10 seconds?

questions.explanation: Authentication, authorization, and accounting are network services collectively known as MA. Authentication requires users to prove who they are. Authorization determines which resources the user can access. Accounting keeps track of the actions of the user.
options: To require users to prove who they are
To determine which resources a user can access
To keep track of the actions of a user
To provide challenge and response questions
questions.question: What is the purpose of the network security accounting function?

questions.explanation: A firewall is one of the most effective security tools for protecting internal network users from external threats. It acts as a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external networks, such as the internet, and controls the traffic between them to prevent unauthorized access.
questions.question: What is one of the most effective security tools available for protecting users from external threats?

questions.explanation: N/A
questions.question: Which type of network threat is intended to prevent authorized users from accessing resources?

questions.explanation: ARP is a protocol used with IPv4 to map a MAC address to an associated specific IP address. The command arp -a will display the MAC address table an a Windows PC.
questions.question: A cybersecurity analyst believes an attacker is spoofing the MAC address of the default gateway to perform a man-in-the-middle attack. Which command should the analyst use to view the MAC address a host is using to reach the default gateway?

questions.explanation: The authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) framework provides essential services to secure access to network devices by verifying user identities, granting appropriate access levels, and tracking user activities.
questions.question: Which three services are provided by the AAA framework? (Choose three.)

questions.explanation: N/A
questions.question: Which malicious code attack is self-contained and tries to exploit a specific vulnerability in a system being attacked?

questions.explanation: A vulnerability is a weakness in a system or software that can be exploited by an attacker to gain unauthorized access or cause harm.
options: A weakness that makes a target susceptible to an attack
A computer that contains sensitive information
A method of attack to exploit a target
A known target or victim machine
A potential threat that a hacker creates
questions.question: What does the term vulnerability mean?

questions.explanation: To implement SSH on a router the following steps need to be performed: - Configure a unique hostname. - Configure the domain name of the network. - Configure a user account to use AAA or local database for authentication. - Generate RSA keys. - Enable VTY SSH sessions.
options: A password on the console line
questions.question: What three configuration steps must be performed to implement SSH access to a router? (Choose three.)

questions.explanation: Smartcard and file system settings do not influence network traffic. MAC address settings can control device access but not specific traffic types like ICMP. Firewall settings are appropriate for blocking ICMP traffic, which is used for ping operations.
questions.question: For security reasons a network administrator needs to ensure that local computers cannot ping each other. Which settings can accomplish this task?

questions.explanation:
Explanation: A man-in-the-middle (MitM) attack occurs when a threat actor secretly positions themselves between two communicating endpoints. By intercepting the traffic, the attacker can:
  • Eavesdrop: Silently monitor and capture sensitive data (confidentiality breach).
  • Manipulate: Alter the data packets before forwarding them to the original destination (integrity breach).
In a typical Cisco network environment, MitM attacks often leverage techniques such as ARP Spoofing, where the attacker sends falsified ARP messages to link their MAC address with the IP address of a legitimate gateway or host. This causes traffic to be routed through the attacker's device instead of the intended path.Incorrect Options:
  • Denial-of-Service (DoS): This attack aims to overwhelm a system or network resource to make it unavailable to legitimate users, rather than intercepting data between endpoints.
  • Extraction of security parameters: This typically refers to obtaining encryption keys or passwords from a device or configuration file, often through physical access or malware.
  • Username enumeration: This is a reconnaissance technique used to identify valid usernames on a system by observing server responses, often as a precursor to a brute-force attack.
questions.question: Which attack involves a compromise of data that occurs between two end points?

questions.explanation: Using different defenses at various points of the network creates a layered approach, enhancing security by providing multiple barriers against potential threats.
questions.question: A user is redesigning a network for a small company and wants to ensure security at a reasonable price. The user deploys a new application-aware firewall with intrusion detection capabilities on the ISP connection. The user installs a second firewall to separate the company network from the public network. Additionally, the user installs an IPS on the internal network of the company. What approach is the user implementing?

questions.explanation: SSH provides secure access to a network device for remote management by encrypting the data transmitted during the session, unlike Telnet, which sends data in plaintext.
questions.question: Which benefit does SSH offer over Telnet for remotely managing a router?

questions.explanation: A Trojan horse is a type of malicious software that misleads users of its true intent by masquerading as a legitimate program. Unlike viruses and worms, which spread by attaching to other programs or exploiting vulnerabilities, a Trojan horse relies on users to install it, thinking it is a benign application.
options: malware that was written to look like a video game
malware that requires manual user intervention to spread between systems
malware that attaches itself to a legitimate program and spreads to other programs when launched
malware that can automatically spread from one system to another by exploiting a vulnerability in the target
questions.question: Which example of malicious code would be classified as a Trojan horse?

questions.explanation: SSH provides a secure remote login through a virtual interface. SSH provides a stronger password authentication than Telnet. SSH also encrypts the data during the session.
options: Out-of-band access to a switch through the use of a virtual terminal with password authentication
Remote access to the switch through the use of a telephone dialup connection
On-site access to a switch through the use of a directly connected PC and a console cable
Remote access to a switch where data is encrypted during the session
Direct access to the switch through the use of a terminal emulation program
questions.question: A network administrator establishes a connection to a switch via SSH. What characteristic uniquely describes the SSH connection?

questions.explanation: Stateful packet inspection on a firewall checks that incoming packets are legitimate responses to requests originating from hosts inside the network. It maintains a table of active connections and only allows packets that are part of an established connection. Packet filtering can be used to permit or deny access to resources based on IP or MAC address. Application filtering can permit or deny access based on port number. URL filtering is used to permit or deny access based on URL or on keywords.
questions.question: Which firewall feature is used to ensure that packets coming into a network are legitimate responses to requests initiated from internal hosts?

questions.explanation: Authentication is a security process that requires users to prove their identity, typically through credentials like passwords or biometric data.
options: to require users to prove who they are
to determine which resources a user can access
to keep track of the actions of a user
to provide challenge and response questions
questions.question: What is the purpose of the network security authentication function?

questions.explanation: Executive timeouts allow the Cisco device to automatically disconnect users after they have been idle for the specified time. Console, vty, and aux ports can be configured with executive timeouts.
questions.question: On which two interfaces or ports can security be improved by configuring executive timeouts? (Choose two.)

questions.explanation: The explanation is already clear and concise, highlighting the importance of patching vulnerabilities to prevent worm attacks.
options: Ensure that all systems have the most current virus definitions.
Ensure that AAA is configured in the network.
Download security updates from the operating system vendor and patch all vulnerable systems.
questions.question: What is considered the most effective way to mitigate a worm attack?

questions.explanation: SSH encrypts login information and data, while Telnet transmits data in plaintext.
questions.question: What feature of SSH makes it more secure than Telnet for a device management connection?

questions.explanation:
Explanation: The password choice "admin" is considered extremely weak for several security reasons:
  • Predictability: "admin" is one of the most common default passwords used by manufacturers for initial device configuration.
  • Reconnaissance: Automated scripts and bots (brute-force attacks) prioritize common dictionary words and default credentials to gain unauthorized access.
  • Lack of Complexity: It does not meet any standard security requirements for length, character variety (uppercase, lowercase, numbers), or special characters.
Cisco best practices dictate the use of strong passwords or passphrases (e.g., using the service password-encryption command for local storage or, preferably, the secret command which uses a stronger hashing algorithm like MD5 or SHA-256).Incorrect Options:
  • It is strong because it uses a passphrase: A passphrase is a long string of words (e.g., "TheBlueSkyIsVeryClearToday"). "admin" is a single, short word, not a passphrase.
  • It is strong because it uses a minimum of 10 numbers, letters and special characters: "admin" only contains 5 lowercase letters and fails all complexity requirements.
  • It is strong because it contains 10 numbers and special characters: This statement is factually incorrect as "admin" contains neither numbers nor special characters.
options: It is weak because it is often the default password on new devices.
It is strong because it uses a passphrase.
It is strong because it uses a minimum of 10 numbers, letters and special characters.
It is strong because it contains 10 numbers and special characters.
questions.question: An administrator decides to use "admin" as the password on a newly installed router. Which statement applies to the password choice?

questions.explanation: SSH provides a secure method for remote access to hosts by encrypting network traffic between the SSH client and remote hosts. Although both Telnet and SSH request authentication before a connection is established, Telnet does not support encryption of login credentials.
options: SSH provides secure communications to access hosts.
SSH supports authentication for a connection request.
questions.question: What is the advantage of using SSH over Telnet?

questions.explanation: Network security focuses on protecting sensitive data and ensuring it's available to authorized users, preventing unauthorized access and data breaches.
options: It ensures sensitive corporate data is available for authorized users.
It prioritizes data flows in order to give priority to delay-sensitive traffic.
It supports growth over time in accordance with approved network design procedures.
It synchronizes traffic flows using timestamps.
questions.question: Which statement describes network security?

questions.explanation: The explanation is already clear and concise, accurately describing the necessity of the 'terminal monitor' command for remote sessions.
questions.question: Which command should be used on a Cisco router or switch to allow log messages to be displayed on remotely connected sessions using Telnet or SSH?

questions.explanation: Spyware is malicious software (malware) that is installed on a network device and collects information without the user's knowledge or consent. In the scenario described in the materials, a technician discovered software that was secretly installed on a computer and collecting data about websites that were visited by users of the computer. This is a characteristic definition of spyware. Spyware differs from other types of malicious software: DoS (Denial of Service) Attack: An attack that slows or crashes a device or network service Identity Theft: The use of stolen credentials to access private data Firewall: A network device that filters access and traffic coming into a network (this is a protective device, not a threat) The key characteristic of spyware is that it operates silently in the background, collecting sensitive user information such as browsing history, passwords, personal data, or financial information, without the user's awareness or permission.
options: software that is installed on a user device and collects information about the user
an attack that slows or crashes a device or network service
the use of stolen credentials to access private data
a network device that filters access and traffic coming into a network
questions.question: What characteristic describes spyware?

questions.explanation: Wireless LAN controllers and IPS are intermediary devices.
questions.question: Which two devices would be described as intermediary devices? (Choose two.)

questions.explanation: A DoS (denial of service) attack prevents authorized users from using one or more computing resources.
questions.question: The employees and residents of Ciscoville cannot access the Internet or any remote web-based services. IT workers quickly determine that the city firewall is being flooded with so much traffic that a breakdown of connectivity to the Internet is occurring. Which type of attack is being launched at Ciscoville?

questions.explanation: SSH is automatically enabled alter the RSA keys are generated. Setting user privilege levels and configuring role-based CLI access are good security practices but are not a requirement of implementing SSH.
options: Configure the correct IP domain name.
Create a valid local username and password database.
Manually enable SSH after the RSA keys are generated.

SSH is automatically enabled after the RSA keys are generated. Setting user privilege levels and configuring role-based CLI access are good security practices but are not a requirement of implementing SSH.
questions.question: When configuring SSH on a router to implement secure network management, a network engineer has issued the login local and transport input ssh line vty commands. What three additional configuration actions have to be performed to complete the SSH configuration? (Choose three.)

questions.explanation: The login block-for 180 attempts 2 within 30 command will cause the device to block authentication after 2 unsuccessful attempts within 30 seconds for a duration of 180 seconds. A device inspecting the traffic on a link has nothing to do with the router. The router configuration cannot prevent unauthorized access to the equipment room. A worm would not attempt to access the router to propagate to another part of the network.
options: a user who is trying to guess a password to access the router
a worm that is attempting to access another part of the network
an unidentified individual who is trying to access the network equipment room
a device that is trying to inspect the traffic on a link
questions.question: A network administrator is issuing the login block-for 180 attempts 2 within 30 command on a router. Which threat is the network administrator trying to prevent?

questions.explanation: SSH encrypts data, providing secure access to network devices, unlike Telnet, which sends data in clear text. FTP and HTTP are not used for secure remote configuration.
questions.question: A technician is to document the current configurations of all network devices in a college, including those in off-site buildings. Which protocol would be best to use to securely access the network devices?

questions.explanation: Using antivirus software and keeping software up to date are effective ways to protect a computer from malware because they help detect, remove, and prevent vulnerabilities that malware can exploit.
questions.question: What are two ways to protect a computer from malware? (Choose two.)
What characteristic describes spyware?
options: software that is installed on a user device and collects information about the user
an attack that slows or crashes a device or network service
the use of stolen credentials to access private data
a network device that filters access and traffic coming into a network
questions.explanation: Spyware is malicious software that is installed on a user device (often without the user's knowledge) and collects information about the user, such as browsing habits, keystrokes, or personal data. A DoS attack slows or crashes services. Using stolen credentials describes credential theft. A firewall filters traffic.

questions.question: What two protocols are supported on Cisco devices for AAA communications? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Two AAA protocols are supported on Cisco devices, TACACS+ and RADIUS. Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP) is used on Cisco routers to allow for gateway redundancy. Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) is a protocol for neighbor discovery. VLAN trunking protocol (VTP) is used on Cisco switches to manage VLANs on a VTP-enabled server switch.

questions.question: Which service is enabled on a Cisco router by default that can reveal significant information about the router and potentially make it more vulnerable to attack?
questions.explanation: CDP is a Cisco proprietary protocol that gathers information from other connected Cisco devices, and is enabled by default on Cisco devices. LLDP is an open standard protocol which provides the same service. It can be enabled on a Cisco router. HTTP and FTP are Application Layer protocols that do not collect information about network devices.
Port 22 is commonly used for SSH (Secure Shell) which is a cryptographic network protocol for operating network services securely over an unsecured network.
questions.question: A client packet is received by a server. The packet has a destination port number of 22. What service is the client requesting?
When security is a concern, which OSI Layer is considered to be the weakest link in a network system?
questions.explanation: Security is only as strong as the weakest link in the system, and Layer 2 is considered to be that weakest link. In addition to protecting Layer 3 to Layer 7, network security professionals must also mitigate attacks to the Layer 2 LAN infrastructure.

questions.question: Which Layer 2 attack will result in a switch flooding incoming frames to all ports?
questions.explanation: When an attacker rapidly sends frames with spoofed MAC addresses to a switch, the MAC address table of the switch becomes full. Once the MAC address table of the switch is full, the switch will flood all new incoming frames to all ports. This is known as a MAC address overflow (or MAC flooding) attack.

questions.question: Why is authentication with AAA preferred over a local database method?
options: It specifies a different password for each line or port.
It provides a fallback authentication method if the administrator forgets the username or password.
It requires a login and password combination on the console, vty lines, and aux ports.
questions.explanation: The local database method of authentication does not provide a fallback authentication method if an administrator forgets the username or password. Password recovery will be the only option. When authentication with AAA is used, a fallback method can be configured to allow an administrator to use one of many possible backup authentication methods.

questions.question: In a server-based AAA implementation, which protocol will allow the router to successfully communicate with the AAA server?
questions.explanation: With a server-based method, the router accesses a central AAA server using either the Remote Authentication Dial-In User (RADIUS) or Terminal Access Controller Access Control System (TACACS+) protocol. SSH is a protocol used for remote login. 802.1x is a protocol used in port-based authentication. TACACS is a legacy protocol and is no longer used.

questions.question: Which Cisco solution helps prevent MAC and IP address spoofing attacks?
questions.explanation: Cisco provides solutions to help mitigate Layer 2 attacks including: IP Source Guard (IPSG) - prevents MAC and IP address spoofing attacks; Dynamic ARP Inspection (DAI) - prevents ARP spoofing and ARP poisoning attacks; DHCP Snooping - prevents DHCP starvation and SHCP spoofing attacks; Port Security - prevents many types of attacks including MAC table overflow attacks and DHCP starvation attacks.

questions.question: What is the purpose of AAA accounting?
options: To collect and report application usage
To determine which operations the user can perform
To determine which resources the user can access
To prove users are who they say they are
questions.explanation: AAA accounting collects and reports application usage data. This data can be used for such purposes as auditing or billing. AAA authentication is the process of verifying users are who they say they are. AAA authorization is what the users can and cannot do on the network after they are authenticated.

questions.question: Which Layer 2 attack will result in legitimate users not getting valid IP addresses?
questions.explanation: The DHCP starvation attack causes the exhaustion of the IP address pool of a DHCP server before legitimate users can obtain valid IP addresses.

questions.question: Which three Cisco products focus on endpoint security solutions? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: The primary components of endpoint security solutions are Cisco Email and Web Security appliances, and Cisco NAC appliance. ASA, SSL/IPsec VPN, and IPS sensor appliances all provide security solutions that focus on the enterprise network, not on endpoint devices.

questions.question:
True or False?
In the 802.1X standard, the client attempting to access the network is referred to as the supplicant.
questions.explanation: In 802.1X terminology the client workstation is known as the supplicant.

questions.question: What is involved in an IP address spoofing attack?
options: A rogue node replies to an ARP request with its own MAC address indicated for the target IP address.
A rogue DHCP server provides false IP configuration parameters to legitimate DHCP clients.
A legitimate network IP address is hijacked by a rogue node.
Bogus DHCPDISCOVER messages are sent to consume all the available IP addresses on a DHCP server.
questions.explanation: In an IP address spoofing attack, the IP address of a legitimate network host is hijacked and used by a rogue node. This allows the rogue node to pose as a valid node on the network.

questions.question: What three services are provided by the AAA framework? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: The authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) framework provides services to help secure access to network devices.

questions.question: Because of implemented security controls, a user can only access a server with FTP. Which AAA component accomplishes this?
questions.explanation: One of the components in AAA is authorization. After a user is authenticated through AAA, authorization services determine which resources the user can access and which operations the user is allowed to perform.

questions.question: What mitigation plan is best for thwarting a DoS attack that is creating a MAC address table overflow?
options: Place unused ports in an unused VLAN
questions.explanation: A MAC address (CAM) table overflow attack, buffer overflow, and MAC address spoofing can all be mitigated by configuring port security. A network administrator would typically not want to disable STP because it prevents Layer 2 loops. DTP is disabled to prevent VLAN hopping. Placing unused ports in an unused VLAN prevents unauthorized wired connectivity.

questions.question: Which command would be best to use on an unused switch port if a company adheres to the best practices as recommended by Cisco?
questions.explanation: Unlike router Ethernet ports, switch ports are enabled by default. Cisco recommends disabling any port that is not used. The 'ip dhcp snooping' command globally enables DHCP snooping on a switch. Further configuration allows defining ports that can respond to DHCP requests. The 'switchport port-security' command is used to protect the network from unidentified or unauthorized attachment of network devices.

questions.question: Which two features on a Cisco Catalyst switch can be used to mitigate DHCP starvation and DHCP spoofing attacks? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: In DHCP starvation attacks, an attacker floods the DHCP server with DHCP requests to use up all the available IP addresses that the DHCP server can issue. In DHCP spoofing attacks, an attacker configures a fake DHCP server on the network so that it provides clients with false DNS server addresses. The port security feature can limit the number of dynamically learned MAC addresses per port or allow only known valid NICs to be connected via their specific MAC addresses. The DHCP snooping feature can identify the legitimate DHCP servers and block fake DHCP servers from issuing IP address information. These two features can help fight against DHCP attacks.

questions.question: What is the best way to prevent a VLAN hopping attack?
options: Use VLAN 1 as the native VLAN on trunk ports.
Disable trunk negotiation for trunk ports and statically set nontrunk ports as access ports.
Use ISL encapsulation on all trunk links.
Disable STP on all nontrunk ports.
questions.explanation: VLAN hopping attacks rely on the attacker being able to create a trunk link with a switch. Disabling DTP and configuring user-facing ports as static access ports can help prevent these types of attacks. Disabling the Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) will not eliminate VLAN hopping attacks.

questions.question: Which procedure is recommended to mitigate the chances of ARP spoofing?
options: Enable IP Source Guard on trusted ports.
Enable DHCP snooping on selected VLANs.
Enable DAI on the management VLAN.
questions.explanation: To mitigate the chances of ARP spoofing, these procedures are recommended: Implement protection against DHCP spoofing by enabling DHCP snooping globally. Enable DHCP snooping on selected VLANs. Enable DAI on selected VLANs. Configure trusted interfaces for DHCP snooping and ARP inspection. Untrusted ports are configured by default.

questions.question: What are two types of switch ports that are used on Cisco switches as part of the defense against DHCP spoofing attacks? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: DHCP snooping recognizes two types of ports on Cisco switches: Trusted DHCP ports - switch ports connecting to upstream DHCP servers; Untrusted ports - switch ports connecting to hosts that should not be providing DHCP server messages.

questions.question: An administrator who is troubleshooting connectivity issues on a switch notices that a switch port configured for port security is in the err-disabled state. After verifying the cause of the violation, how should the administrator re-enable the port without disrupting network operation?
options: Issue the no switchport port-security command, then re-enable port security.
Issue the shutdown command followed by the no shutdown command on the interface.
Issue the no switchport port-security violation shutdown command on the interface.
questions.explanation: If an interface that has been protected with port security goes into the err-disabled state, then a violation has occurred and the administrator should investigate the cause of the violation. Once the cause is determined, the administrator can issue the 'shutdown' command followed by the 'no shutdown' command to enable the interface.

questions.question: A network administrator is configuring DHCP snooping on a switch. Which configuration command should be used first?
questions.explanation: The steps to enable DHCP snooping include these: Step 1. Enable DHCP snooping using the 'ip dhcp snooping' global configuration command. Step 2. On trusted ports, use the 'ip dhcp snooping trust' interface configuration command. Step 3. Enable DHCP snooping by VLAN, or by a range of VLANs.

questions.question: A network administrator is configuring DAI on a switch with the command ip arp inspection validate dst-mac. What is the purpose of this configuration command?
options: To check the destination MAC address in the Ethernet header against the target MAC address in the ARP body
To check the destination MAC address in the Ethernet header against the source MAC address in the ARP body
To check the destination MAC address in the Ethernet header against the MAC address table
To check the destination MAC address in the Ethernet header against the user-configured ARP ACLs
questions.explanation: DAI can be configured to check for both destination or source MAC and IP addresses: Destination MAC - Checks the destination MAC address in the Ethernet header against the target MAC address in the ARP body. Source MAC - Checks the source MAC address in the Ethernet header against the sender MAC address in the ARP body. IP address - Checks the ARP body for invalid and unexpected IP addresses including addresses 0.0.0.0, 255.255.255.255, and all IP multicast addresses.

questions.question: Which security feature should be enabled in order to prevent an attacker from overflowing the MAC address table of a switch?
questions.explanation: Port security limits the number of source MAC addresses allowed through a switch port. This feature can prevent an attacker from flooding a switch with many spoofed MAC addresses.

questions.question: What Layer 2 attack is mitigated by disabling Dynamic Trunking Protocol?
questions.explanation: Mitigating a VLAN hopping attack can be done by disabling Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP) and by setting the native VLAN of trunk links to VLANs not in use.

questions.question: A network administrator is configuring DAI on a switch. Which command should be used on the uplink interface that connects to a router?
questions.explanation: In general, a router serves as the default gateway for the LAN or VLAN on the switch. Therefore, the uplink interface that connects to a router should be a trusted port for forwarding ARP requests.

questions.question: Where are dynamically learned MAC addresses stored when sticky learning is enabled with the switchport port-security mac-address sticky command?
questions.explanation: When MAC addresses are automatically learned by using the sticky command option, the learned MAC addresses are added to the running configuration, which is stored in RAM. To persist sticky MAC addresses across reboots, the running configuration must be saved to the startup configuration in NVRAM.

questions.question: Which method of wireless authentication is currently considered to be the strongest?
questions.explanation: WPA2 can use the AES encryption standard, which is currently the strongest method of encrypting wireless data.

questions.question: Match the type of information security threat to the scenario.

rightColumn.label: installing virus code to destroy surveillance recordings for certain days
pretending to be someone else by using stolen personal information to apply for a credit card
preventing users from accessing a website by sending a large number of link requests in a short period

questions.explanation: Data loss involves destroying or corrupting data (virus destroying recordings). Identity theft is using someone's personal information fraudulently. Disruption of service (DoS) prevents legitimate access to services. Information theft is unauthorized acquisition of confidential data.

questions.question: Match each weakness with an example.

rightColumn.label: When implementing an access list on a router, a network engineer did not filter a type of malicious traffic
A network engineer is examining the operating system of a network device for vulnerabilities
The network administrator did not fully consider the implications of unauthorized users accessing the network

questions.explanation: Configuration weakness results from improperly configured devices (incomplete ACL). Technological weakness involves flaws in hardware or software (OS vulnerabilities). Security policy weakness stems from inadequate policies (not considering unauthorized access implications).

questions.question: Which protocol provides up to 16 instances of RSTP, combines many VLANs with the same physical and logical topology into a common RSTP instance, and provides support for PortFast, BPDU guard, BPDU filter, root guard, and loop guard?
questions.explanation: MST is the Cisco implementation of MSTP, an IEEE standard protocol that provides up to 16 instances of RSTP and combines many VLANs with the same physical and logical topology into a common RSTP instance. Each instance supports PortFast, BPDU guard, BPDU filter, root guard, and loop guard. STP and RSTP assume only one spanning-tree instance for the entire bridged network. PVST+ provides a separate 802.1D spanning-tree instance for each VLAN.
HTTPS uses Secure Socket Layer (SSL) or Transport Layer Security (TLS) to encrypt traffic between a client and a web server, ensuring data confidentiality and integrity.
questions.question: Which protocol uses encryption?

questions.explanation: Topic 16.2.0 - For reconnaissance attacks, external attackers can use Internet tools, such as the nslookup and whois utilities, to easily determine the IP address space assigned to a given corporation or entity. After the IP address space is determined, an attacker can then ping the publicly available IP addresses to identify the addresses that are active. Fping is a ping sweep tool that can help automate this process.
questions.question: What type of attack may involve the use of tools such as nslookup and fping?

questions.explanation: Reconnaissance is a preliminary phase of an attack where the attacker gathers information about a network to identify potential vulnerabilities. This can include scanning for open ports, identifying active devices, and gathering network topology information.
questions.question: Which type of attack involves an adversary attempting to gather information about a network to identify vulnerabilities?

questions.explanation: The explanation should clarify that stateful firewalls track the state of connections and can filter based on application layer information, while packet-filtering firewalls are limited to filtering at the network and transport layers.
options: Both stateful and packet-filtering firewalls can filter at the application layer.
A stateful firewall can filter application layer information, whereas a packet-filtering firewall cannot filter beyond the network layer.
A packet-filtering firewall typically can filter up to the transport layer, whereas a stateful firewall can filter up to the session layer.
A packet-filtering firewall uses session layer information to track the state of a connection, whereas a stateful firewall uses application layer information to track the state of a connection.

Packet filtering firewalls can always filter Layer 3 content and sometimes TCP and UDP-based content. Stateful firewalls monitor connections and thus have to be able to support up to the session layer of the OSI model.
questions.question: Which statement describes the characteristics of packet-filtering and stateful firewalls as they relate to the OSI model?
What advantage does SSH offer over Telnet?
questions.explanation: Both Telnet and SSH are used to remotely connect to a network device for management tasks. However, Telnet uses plaintext communications, whereas SSH provides security for remote connections by providing encryption of all transmitted data between devices.

questions.question: What must an administrator have in order to reset a lost password on a router?
questions.explanation: Console access to the device through a terminal or terminal emulator software on a PC is required for password recovery. This requires physical access to the router to connect via the console port.

questions.question: When configuring a switch for SSH access, what other command that is associated with the login local command is required to be entered on the switch?
options: login block-for seconds attempts number within seconds
questions.explanation: The login local command designates that the local username database is used to authenticate interfaces such as console or vty. Therefore, at least one local username must be created using the 'username username secret secret' command.

questions.question:
Refer to the exhibit. The network administrator wants to configure Switch1 to allow SSH connections and prohibit Telnet connections. How should the network administrator change the displayed configuration to satisfy the requirement?

Switch1(config)# ip ssh version 2
Switch1(config)# ip domain-name cisco.com
Switch1(config)# crypto key generate rsa
Switch1(config)# line vty 0-15
Switch1(config-line)# transport input all
options: Configure SSH on a different line.
questions.explanation: The current configuration shows 'transport input all' which allows both SSH and Telnet connections. To allow only SSH and prohibit Telnet, the administrator should change this to 'transport input ssh'. The SSH version and RSA key configuration are correct.

questions.question: Which protocol adds security to remote connections?
questions.explanation: SSH (Secure Shell) allows a technician to securely connect to a remote network device for monitoring and troubleshooting. It provides encryption for the session. HTTP establishes web page requests. FTP manages file transfer but is not encrypted. NetBEUI is not routed on the Internet. POP downloads email messages from email servers.

questions.question: What advantage does SSH offer over Telnet?
questions.explanation: Both Telnet and SSH are used to remotely connect to a network device for management tasks. However, Telnet uses plaintext communications, whereas SSH provides security for remote connections by providing encryption of all transmitted data between devices.

questions.question: What must an administrator have in order to reset a lost password on a router?
questions.explanation: Console access to the device through a terminal or terminal emulator software on a PC is required for password recovery.
